content.user_title: Build Modern Frontend Apps with React
content.value_statement: Building complex frontend applications requires deep expertise in React patterns, performance optimization, and state management. This skill provides senior-level guidance for component architecture, bundle optimization, and implementing production-ready UI systems using industry best practices.
actual_capabilities: Generate React components with TypeScript and proper folder structure
Analyze and optimize JavaScript bundle sizes for faster loads
Apply React patterns including hooks, context, and render props
Implement Next.js optimization techniques for SSR and SSG
Configure Tailwind CSS and responsive design systems
Review code for frontend best practices and anti-patterns
limitations: Does not execute build commands or deploy applications
Does not access external APIs or services
Does not modify user files without explicit permission
Scripts require Python 3.6+ to run locally

use_cases.title: Component Architecture
use_cases.description: Design and scaffold React components with proper TypeScript types, hooks, and folder structure.

use_cases.title: Bundle Optimization
use_cases.description: Analyze bundle size and identify opportunities to reduce JavaScript payload for better performance.

use_cases.title: Code Review Guide
use_cases.description: Apply consistent frontend patterns and identify anti-patterns during code reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React component for [component name] using TypeScript. Include proper props interface, error handling, and follow modern hooks patterns. Use Tailwind CSS for styling.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize Bundle
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the bundle size of my React application and identify large dependencies. Suggest code splitting strategies and lazy loading approaches to reduce initial load time.

prompt_templates.title: React Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement [specific pattern] for managing global state in React. Compare React Context, Zustand, and Jotai for this use case and explain trade-offs.

prompt_templates.title: Next.js Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up Next.js with App Router for my project. Include proper SSR configuration, image optimization, and explain when to use server components versus client components.

output_examples.input: Create a Button component with loading state
output: Component structure with proper TypeScript interface
Loading state handling with spinner integration
Tailwind CSS classes for variants (primary, secondary, outline)
Export statement and barrel file update recommendation

output_examples.input: How do I reduce my Next.js bundle size?
output: Identify large dependencies using bundle analyzer
Implement dynamic imports for route-based code splitting
Configure next/image for automatic image optimization
Use React.lazy() for component-level lazy loading
Enable tree shaking by using ES modules

output_examples.input: What are common React anti-patterns to avoid?
output: Prop drilling through many layers - use context instead
Business logic in components - extract to custom hooks
Large monolithic components - split by feature
Missing error boundaries - wrap components with ErrorBoundary
Direct state mutation - always use setState or state managers

best_practices: Use TypeScript for all components to catch errors at compile time
Implement proper error boundaries to prevent app crashes
Lazy load routes and heavy components to reduce initial bundle size
anti_patterns: Avoid prop drilling through many layers; use context or state management
Do not put business logic directly in components; extract to custom hooks
Avoid large monolithic components; split by feature and responsibility

faq.question: Which React frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill covers Next.js, React Native, and general React patterns applicable to any framework using React.

faq.question: Can this skill optimize large production applications?
faq.answer: Yes, the bundle analyzer identifies large dependencies and suggests code splitting, tree shaking, and lazy loading strategies.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, all scripts accept a target path parameter and work with any React/Next.js project structure.

faq.question: What data does this skill access or collect?
faq.answer: Scripts only read files in user-specified paths and write JSON reports to user-specified output locations. No external data collection.

faq.question: How is this different from using Claude directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured workflows, ready-to-use Python scripts, and curated reference documentation for common frontend tasks.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI coding tools?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and any AI assistant that can read reference files and execute local scripts.
